alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 4:56AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Conecuh, Covington, Crenshaw and Escambia. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andalusia, Opp, Florala, Brantley, River Falls, Red Level, Lockhart, Dozier, Heath, Gantt, Carolina, Beck, Stanley, Loango, Red Oak, Rhump, Rome, Sanford, Valley Of Shiloh and Straughn.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
